Patch Set 1:

cool.

I wonder when we can just kill node-smartdc. E.g. do we need to have an answer for the chmod/policy stuff (there is a hidden 'triton rbac ...' that could be advertised for that). Do we need 'triton' CLI for CA? Or will we deprecate CA in favour of CMON?

Anyway, yah, still have the nics and fabrics stuff. And 'triton image export'. And probably more.
Change has been successfully merged by Angela Fong
I'd be inclined to just drop this whole paragraph. People can learn by reading "triton inst create -h" et al. Perhaps show usage of "-n NAME" in the triton example.

The id vs name convention is a constant challenge for people new to the APIs (which I've observed in the last few months). Unfortunately `sdc-createmachine --help` does not tell you that it accepts only ids and people got frustrated after trying with names first. So this is why someone added this paragraph in the first place. Now with triton CLI, people are led to think that it accepts ids only. So as much as this doc update highlights the inconsistencies, I think it's still a helpful mention... And yeah we want people to rely more on `--help`, as long as they tell you what form of input it expects.

sorry to nit, but possible to have triton in the first column?  "I don't want to know" is a fine answer. :)

A bonus of doing this is that one could sort on meaningful names: 'triton instance ...' would all sort together.

Actually I thought about this too. The commands are already grouped by object in the main sections of the doc. I think this part is meant for quick alphabetical lookup. I suggest that we do an overall restructuring of the doc once when we've plugged few more major gaps in triton CLI.
